turn.3: Has there been any growth in the last decade?
turn.4: After Miklós Horthy's government banned the organisation, some members went abroad.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Among them was Ótto János Homonnay, who in the 1960s, in Canada, established the Hungarian Turul Society to promote the Turanist theses.

turn.8: In 1979, after Homonnay's death, János Páll took over the leadership of the group.
turn.10: The Community of Hungarian Religion was founded in Hungary in 1992 as a continuation of the Turul Society.
turn.12: The current leader is Attila Kovács, according to whom the church already had gathered around one thousand members in the late 1990s.
